comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Just for my understanding:This is the PK version which doesnt need the 2fa shit from Tim right?I didn't follow the whole drama but it seems that some of the 2fa coins weren't actually loaded, right?

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: seek3r on September 11, 2023, 12:03:48 PMJust for my understanding:This is the PK version which doesnt need the 2fa shit from Tim right?I didn't follow the whole drama but it seems that some of the 2fa coins weren't actually loaded, right?yes - this is a PK version not a 2fa version.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: seek3r on September 11, 2023, 12:03:48 PMJust for my understanding:This is the PK version which doesnt need the 2fa shit from Tim right?I didn't follow the whole drama but it seems that some of the 2fa coins weren't actually loaded, right?Correct... from what I have seen/held in hand, is that ALL of the 2017 0.1BTC Titan coins are Private Key (PK) versions AND use the first-bits as their code on the hologramJust peel and redeem And correct, apparently there are a few 2FA coins that were never "funded".. but this might have been a case of customer not confirming reception and load never sent.I know quite a few coin makers ship this way to prevent any lost BTC in case the coins go missing/stolen

Am I have to keep it forever and let it be there?   I think best way to get updates for that case is to follow this thread:Titan Mint Coins- Serious Issue- Titan Mint Bitcoin Coins ***NEW UPDATES***You should read the last few pages to get the infos that you need.
